newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midcontinent high sulphur diesel firms.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midcontinent high sulphur diesel firms.

text.p: U.S. Midcontinent high sulpur diesel firmed late Tuesday in the Group Three spot market on surging agricultural demand and perceptions of tightened inventories, traders said.

Midwest refineries reported 8.98 million barrels of high sulphur inventories on hand in the PADD 2 region, an 825,000 barrel draw on the week, the American Petroleum Institute said in its weekly stocks survey.

But traders said the Williams pipeline system appeared to have ample stocks on hand even as high sulphur diesel rose to 4.25/4.50 cents a gallon over NYMEX May heating oil late in the day. High sulphur was heard done 2.30 cents over the print in Chicago.
Low sulphur diesel for April deliveries was bid 5.0 cents a gallon over the print in Group Three and 4.50 cents over in Chicago, traders said.
Group Three unleaded gasoline for April deliveries was talked 3.0/2.75 cents a gallon under NYMEX May unleaded, with Chicago unleaded firming to 2.0/1.75 cents a gallon under the print.
Gasoline stocks on hand at Midwest refineries were pegged at 53.12 million barrels, down 1.46 million barrels on the week, API said.
